abstracts.cdata!:
The Chiapas Agricultural Development
            Project is one of two being presented simultaneously as part
            of the Bank's participation in an integrated
            development program for the State of Chiapas, in
            Southeastern Mexico.  The Chiapas Development Plan is
            designed to address the main constraints to the development
            of the State through an integrated approach placed in the
            context of a wider development scheme for the southeastern
            region of the country.  At the core of this program are the
            investments required to achieve a more balanced
            socioeconomic development in the areas of influence of the
            proposed parallel agriculture and rural roads projects.  The
            project supports the initial phase of this program through
            execution of an agricultural development program in
            coordination with other social and economic development
            efforts.  The project covers an area of about 317,500 ha.
            To achieve its objectives the project provides for:  (a)
            construction of flood control and road works; (b)
            strengthening of administration; (c) carrying out on-farm
            development works; and (d) provision of soil conservation
            structures.  It further includes; (e) strengthening of
            production support services; and (f) preparation of studies.
